content:
sequenceDiagram
    participant "User" as User
    participant "Phone List Page" as PhoneListPage
    participant "Modal Pop-up" as ModalPopUp
    participant "Backend API" as BackendAPI
    participant "Database" as Database

    note left: System Boundaries
        Frontend (UI/UX)
            - User interacts with the phone list page
            - Clicks the "Request Phone Swap" button
        Backend (Logic)
            - Handles form submissions via POST /api/phone-swaps API endpoint
            - Validates user requests and database interactions

    note right: Component Relationships
        User ->> PhoneListPage: Request Phone Swap
        PhoneListPage ->> ModalPopUp: Trigger modal pop-up
        ModalPopUp ->> BackendAPI: Submit form data via POST /api/phone-swaps API endpoint
        BackendAPI ->> Database: Store swap requests in database table

    note left: Data Flow
        User ->> PhoneListPage: Select phone to request and offer in exchange
        PhoneListPage ->> ModalPopUp: Display modal pop-up with form data
        ModalPopUp ->> BackendAPI: Submit form data via POST /api/phone-swaps API endpoint
        BackendAPI ->> Database: Store swap requests in database table

    note right: System Architecture
        Frontend (UI/UX)
            - Phone List Page: Displays phone list and "Request Phone Swap" button
            - Modal Pop-up: Handles form data submission and display
        Backend (Logic)
            - Backend API: Handles form submissions, validates user requests, and interacts with database
            - Database: Stores swap requests in a new table

    note left: Notes
        The system architecture diagram illustrates the interactions between components and the flow of data.
        It highlights the system boundaries, component relationships, and data flow within the Phone Swap Request feature.

```mermaid

    participant "User" as User

    note left: System Boundaries

            - User interacts with the phone list page

        Backend (Logic)

            - Validates user requests and database interactions

    note right: Component Relationships
        User ->> PhoneListPage: Request Phone Swap
        PhoneListPage ->> ModalPopUp: Trigger modal pop-up
        ModalPopUp ->> BackendAPI: Submit form data via POST /api/phone-swaps API endpoint

    note left: Data Flow

        PhoneListPage ->> ModalPopUp: Display modal pop-up with form data
        ModalPopUp ->> BackendAPI: Submit form data via POST /api/phone-swaps API endpoint
        BackendAPI ->> Database: Store swap requests in database table

    note right: System Architecture

            - Modal Pop-up: Handles form data submission and display

    note left: Notes

        It highlights the system boundaries, component relationships, and data flow within the Phone Swap Request feature.
```

This System Architecture Diagram provides a comprehensive overview of the phone swap request feature, showcasing the interactions between components, the flow of data, and the system boundaries.

content:
sequenceDiagram
    participant "User" as User
    participant "Phone List Page" as PhoneListPage
    participant "Modal Pop-up" as ModalPopUp
    participant "Backend API" as BackendAPI
    participant "Database" as Database
    note left: System Boundaries
    Frontend (UI/UX)
    - User interacts with the phone list page
    - Clicks the "Request Phone Swap" button
    Backend (Logic)
    - Handles form submissions via POST /api/phone-swaps API endpoint
    - Validates user requests and database interactions
    note right: Component Relationships
    User ->> PhoneListPage: Request Phone Swap
    PhoneListPage ->> ModalPopUp: Trigger modal pop-up
    ModalPopUp ->> BackendAPI: Submit form data via POST /api/phone-swaps API endpoint
    BackendAPI ->> Database: Store swap requests in database table
    note left: Data Flow
    User ->> PhoneListPage: Select phone to request and offer in exchange
    PhoneListPage ->> ModalPopUp: Display modal pop-up with form data
    ModalPopUp ->> BackendAPI: Submit form data via POST /api/phone-swaps API endpoint
    BackendAPI ->> Database: Store swap requests in database table
    note right: System Architecture
    Frontend (UI/UX)
    - Phone List Page: Displays phone list and "Request Phone Swap" button
    - Modal Pop-up: Handles form data submission and display
    Backend (Logic)
    - Backend API: Handles form submissions, validates user requests, and interacts with database
    - Database: Stores swap requests in a new table
    note left: Notes
    The system architecture diagram illustrates the interactions between components and the flow of data.
    It highlights the system boundaries, component relationships, and data flow within the Phone Swap Request feature.

flowchart TD
    subgraph Frontend
    UI[User Interface]
    Modal[Modal Pop-up]
    PhoneList[Phone List Page]
    Button[Request Phone Swap Button]
    end
    subgraph Backend
    API[API Gateway]
    Service[Service Layer]
    DB[(Database)]
    PhoneService[Phone Service]
    end
    UI --> Button --> Modal
    Modal -->|Submit Request| API --> Service --> DB
    Modal -->|Cancel| UI
    Service -->|Validate User Ownership| PhoneService
    PhoneService -->|Get Phones List| DB
    DB -->|Return Phones List| PhoneService
    PhoneService -->|Update Phones List| DB
    DB -->|Return Updated Phones List| PhoneService
    P -->|User Interaction| UI
    UI -->|Button Click| Modal
    Modal -->|Form Submission| API
    API -->|API Endpoint|/api/phone-swaps|
    Service -->|Business Logic| DB
    DB -->|Database Operations| PhoneService
    SB -->|Frontend-Backend Interface| UI, API
    SB -->|Backend-Database Interface| Service, DB

flowchart TD subgraph Frontend UI[User Interface] Modal[Modal Pop-up] PhoneList[Phone List Page] Button[Request Phone Swap Button] end subgraph Backend API[API Gateway] Service[Service Layer] DB[(Database)] PhoneService[Phone Service] end UI --> Button --> Modal Modal -->|Submit Request| API --> Service --> DB Modal -->|Cancel| UI Service -->|Validate User Ownership| PhoneService PhoneService -->|Get Phones List| DB DB -->|Return Phones List| PhoneService PhoneService -->|Update Phones List| DB DB -->|Return Updated Phones List| PhoneService P -->|User Interaction| UI UI -->|Button Click| Modal Modal -->|Form Submission| API API -->|API Endpoint|/api/phone-swaps| Service -->|Business Logic| DB DB -->|Database Operations| PhoneService SB -->|Frontend-Backend Interface| UI, API SB -->|Backend-Database Interface| Service, DB

attempts.content:
Here is the Mermaid Architecture diagram based on the provided requirements and project context:
```
flowchart TD
    subgraph Frontend
        UI[User Interface]
        Modal[Modal Pop-up]
        PhoneList[Phone List Page]
        Button[Request Phone Swap Button]
    end

    subgraph Backend
        API[API Gateway]
        Service[Service Layer]
        DB[(Database)]
        PhoneService[Phone Service]
    end

    UI --> Button --> Modal
    Modal -->|Submit Request| API --> Service --> DB
    Modal -->|Cancel| UI
    Service -->|Validate User Ownership| PhoneService
    PhoneService -->|Get Phones List| DB
    DB -->|Return Phones List| PhoneService
    PhoneService -->|Update Phones List| DB
    DB -->|Return Updated Phones List| PhoneService

    note "Phone Swap Request Feature" as P
    P -->|User Interaction| UI
    UI -->|Button Click| Modal
    Modal -->|Form Submission| API
    API -->|API Endpoint|/api/phone-swaps|
    Service -->|Business Logic| DB
    DB -->|Database Operations| PhoneService

    note "System Boundaries" as SB
    SB -->|Frontend-Backend Interface| UI, API
    SB -->|Backend-Database Interface| Service, DB
```
Note that this diagram represents the high-level architecture of the system, focusing on the key components and their relationships. The actual implementation details may vary based on specific requirements and design choices.
